poem:
Tragedy on Granville Street  

A black SUV,  
a predatory machine,  
slicing through the joy  
of festival air—  
its reckless geometry  
breaking into  
the choreography of lives.  
Not terror, but still  
the raw wind of grief  
pulling petals  
from the flowers  
we set down gently  
on this wounded earth.
